Counter - Strike 
¿Es solo un juego? Muchas veces la gente dice "no te pongas asi, es solo "Counter-Strike" Pero ellos no entiendo los matchs jugados , todas las horas en el dm para mejorar el aim para ser un player digno de un team no tienen idea de lo que es adrenalina de parar a los 5 en ronda eco. 
Ellos no entienden la emoción que tenemos al hacer un tk , o aun mejor detonarlos a todos no conocen los nervios de 1 vs 3 con poca hp. 
La adrenalina de darles vuelta un 10-5 que no te importe nada , nada màs lo que tu TL. 
Los nervios cuando queda un teammate en un 1vs1 , con poca hp y sin buy, y la alegría de cuando en este momento el enojo , Los insultos por una pecheada o una mala lata o tan solo dejar c4 en base. la risa con amigos ,teammates , lo que sea pero no conocen esa sastifaccion que nos da jugar al counter. 
Los Gritos y festejos , al ganar una ronda casi perdida. 
La desesperación de cuando estas flashado , y ya pasaste B y no ves nada. 
La decepción Cuando Perdemos una ronda casi ganada. 
El orgullo de ganar un torneo lan o inet tan solo ganar un match contra un team complicado. Ese orgullo que se siente Lo puede comparar con pocas cosas. 
ELLOS NO ENTIENDEN EL AMOR POR EL CS , LAS ALEGRÍAS , LLANTOS , RISAS , FESTEJOS CON AMIGOS POR ESO TE DIGO "No opines del Counter , si nunca pasaste por esto"

Counter-Strike (also known as Half-Life: Counter-Strike) is a first-person shooter video game developed by Valve Corporation. It was initially developed and released as a Half-Life modification by Minh "Gooseman" Le and Jess Cliffe in 1999, before Le and Cliffe were hired and the game's intellectual property acquired. Counter-Strike was first released by Valve on the Microsoft Windows platform in 2000. The game later spawned a franchise, and is the first installment in the Counter-Strike series. Several remakes and Ports of Counter-Strike have been released on the Xbox console, as well as OS X and Linux. It is sometimes referred to as Counter-Strike 1.6 to distinguish it from other titles of the series, 1.6 being the final major software update the game received.

Set in various locations around the globe, players assume the roles of members of combating teams of the governmental counter-terrorist forces and various terrorist militants opposing them. During each round of gameplay, the two teams are tasked with defeating the other by the means of either achieving the map's objectives, or else eliminating all of the enemy combatants. Each player may customize their arsenal of weapons and accessories at the beginning of every match, with currency being earned after the end of each round.

Developer(s)	Valve L.L.C.

Sierra Studios

Genre(s)	First-person shooter
Mode(s)	Multiplayer
